## ⚛️ React动态 {#react}
[![Next.js 13.2](/emails/issues/136/nextjs13.2.jpg)](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-13-2)
**[Next.js 13.2](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-13-2)**

segments.content: A nice release with some new features that Vercel devs had already given us a preview of. The new Metadata API is useful for SEO, works well with SSR streaming, server components and the new app directory. The new Route Handlers seem to have a good usability: co-located, just export the HTTP verb. Particularly excited by the new features around MDX (Rust compiler, Server Components): that should make Next.js content sites much lighter and faster to use. If I understand correctly, Next.js starts using a TypeScript codegen step for typed links (in addition to the TypeScript plugin). Turbopack compatibility with Webpack loaders can make it easier to adopt the new bundler.
segments.sourceMdx: A nice release with some new features that Vercel devs had already given us a preview of. The new Metadata API is useful for SEO, works well with SSR streaming, server components and the new app directory. The new Route Handlers seem to have a good usability: co-located, just export the HTTP verb. Particularly excited by the new features around MDX (Rust compiler, Server Components): that should make Next.js content sites much lighter and faster to use. If I understand correctly, Next.js starts using a TypeScript codegen step for typed links (in addition to the TypeScript plugin). Turbopack compatibility with Webpack loaders can make it easier to adopt the new bundler.
segments.translated_content: 本次重磅更新包含多项Vercel开发者已预告的功能。全新Metadata API完美兼容SSR流式渲染、Server Components和新应用目录，极大提升SEO效率。Route Handlers采用直观设计：同目录部署，直接导出HTTP动词即可。特别值得关注的是MDX相关创新（Rust编译器、Server Components支持），这将使Next.js内容站点更轻量高效。据理解，Next.js现采用TypeScript代码生成步骤来实现类型化链接（在原有TypeScript插件基础上）。Turbopack对Webpack加载器的兼容性将降低新打包器的迁移门槛。

segments.content: The biggest surprise for me is the introduction of a cache API directly integrated to `fetch()`: allows a bit the same thing as ISR but with a finer granularity, at the component level, for each request. There is even a tagging system. Next.js remains portable: the cache can be hosted on your own infrastructure, or use a local LRU cache. Of course, this is optimized for deploying on Vercel. A dedicated article gives more details and explains the limits of the ISR model: [Vercel Cache API: A progressive cache, integrated with Next.js](https://vercel.com/blog/vercel-cache-api-nextjs-cache). See also the [thread of Sebastian Markbåge](https://twitter.com/sebmarkbage/status/1628845420121128965).

segments.translated_content: 最令人惊喜的是直接集成到`fetch()`的缓存API：在组件级别为每个请求提供类似ISR但更精细的缓存控制，甚至包含标签系统。Next.js保持可移植性：缓存可部署在自有基础设施，或使用本地LRU缓存。当然，该功能针对Vercel部署进行了优化。专题文章[Vercel Cache API：与Next.js集成的渐进式缓存](https://vercel.com/blog/vercel-cache-api-nextjs-cache)详细解析了ISR模型的局限性。另可参阅[Sebastian Markbåge的推文](https://twitter.com/sebmarkbage/status/1628845420121128965)。

segments.content: Signals remained the trending topic of the week. I suggest you read for yourself the many discussions that took place on Twitter:
segments.sourceMdx: Signals remained the trending topic of the week. I suggest you read for yourself the many discussions that took place on Twitter:
segments.translated_content: 信号(Signals)仍是本周热议话题。建议您自行阅读Twitter上的诸多讨论：

segments.content:
* Andrew Clark [clarifies his position](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1628811935088013314) and is [not closed to introducing signals into React](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1626590880126889984). The React Forget compiler [could compile to signals](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1628930249718202369).
* Miško Hevery [explains](https://twitter.com/mhevery/status/1628556944318550016) how signals avoid perf problems on the drilling props.
* Evan You [prefers](https://twitter.com/youyuxi/status/1629636673519894528) an understandable mutable model to an immutable model that leaks.
* Devon Govett [reminds us](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1629540226589663233) why "unidirectional data flow" was adopted and points out some problems with signals.
* Jordan Walke [mentions](https://twitter.com/jordwalke/status/1629663133039214593) that they considered using a reactive model when React was created. Rejected because it changed the semantics of the language.
* Dan Abramov [explains](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1629872956288512007) that the user expects to see the same interface for the same data. He [explains](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1629539600489119744) the value of using "raw values" (not wrapped in any container).
* [My position](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1630264713845039104): I largely share the same views as the React team and think we need to continue to innovate on the current model, despite Signals looking attractive in the short term. I hope that eventually JavaScript will support better the immutable model, and that the React Forget compiler is only a transitional step.

- Andrew Clark [阐明立场](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1628811935088013314)并[对在React中引入信号持开放态度](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1626590880126889984)。React Forget编译器[可编译为信号实现](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1628930249718202369)。

- Evan You [更倾向](https://twitter.com/youyuxi/status/1629636673519894528)可理解的可变模型而非存在泄漏的不可变模型。
- Devon Govett [提醒](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1629540226589663233)采用"单向数据流"的初衷，并指出信号的潜在问题。
- Jordan Walke [提及](https://twitter.com/jordwalke/status/1629663133039214593)React创建时曾考虑响应式模型，但因改变语言语义而放弃。
- Dan Abramov [阐释](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1629872956288512007)用户期望相同数据呈现一致界面，并[说明](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1629539600489119744)使用"原始值"(非包装值)的优势。
- [我的观点](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1630264713845039104)：基本认同React团队观点，认为应继续创新现有模型，尽管信号短期颇具吸引力。期待JavaScript未来能更好支持不可变模型，React Forget编译器仅是过渡方案。

segments.content:
* 👥 [Matt Carroll](https://twitter.com/mattcarrollcode) + [Sean Keegan](https://twitter.com/DevRelSean): 2 DevRels recently joined the React team.
* 📜 [Module Extraction: The Silent Web Revolution](https://www.builder.io/blog/module-extraction-the-silent-web-revolution): React frameworks can already separate client/server code in the same module. But frameworks like Qwik go further and can even extract closures (including captured variables). Let's see if this idea scales well on big apps.
* 📜 [Why useEffect May Not Be the Best Abstraction](https://www.builder.io/blog/useeffect-not-the-best-abstraction): criticism of useEffect and comparison with Qwik code.
* 📜 [i18n translations in Next.js 13's app-dir for server/client components](https://aralroca.com/blog/i18n-translations-nextjs-13-app-dir):
  the author of Next-translate explains some difficulties encountered to release the v2 of his lib related to Server Components, but reports some interesting advantages like the reduction of the js bundle size.
* 📜 [React Is Holding Me Hostage](https://emnudge.dev/blog/react-hostage): a rather fair criticism of React that praises the merits of signals and a more reactive model.
* 📜 [useSyncExternalStore - First Look](https://julesblom.com/writing/usesyncexternalstore): ce hook est plus utile qu'il n'en a l'air, ne passez pas a coté!
* 📜 [Owncast v0.1.0 Retrospective - Frontend Web Rewrite](https://gabekangas.com/blog/2023/02/owncast-v0.1.0-retrospective-frontend-web-rewrite/): feedback on the switch from Preact to React/Next.js, including an interesting social outcome (more contributors).
* 📜 [How to avoid tricky async state manager pitfalls in React](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/how-to-avoid-tricky-async-state-manager-pitfalls-react)
* 📜 [React Libraries for 2023](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-libraries/)
* 📜 [Storybook 7 Docs](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-7-docs/)
* 📦 [Suspense](https://github.com/bvaughn/suspense/): toolbox for React Suspense, Brian Vaughn's new project.
* 📦 [TanStack Bling](https://github.com/TanStack/bling/): new framework-agnostic project of the TanStack on which the next TanStack Start meta-framework should be based.
* 📦 [Forgetti](https://github.com/lxsmnsyc/forgetti): a dev doesn't want to wait for the React Forget compiler so he works on his own compiler.
* 📦 [TanStack Query v5.0.0-alpha.0](https://twitter.com/TkDodo/status/1630159547405877249): preview of upcoming v5 improvements: infinite query, optimistic updates, bundle size...

segments.content: Reanimated 3.0 has just been released in a stable version, with a new Shared Elements Transitions feature ([demo](https://twitter.com/swmansion/status/1630590156255240193)). It is now possible to use shared values in inline styles. The library has been rewritten to improve performance, DX and prepare for the arrival of new features. It is compatible with Fabric and the Reanimated 2 API to facilitate the upgrade, but the Reanimated 1 API has been removed.
